thread.title: Mount Jackson resident says runoff from solar farm is still damaging his wife's property
thread.title_full: Mount Jackson resident says runoff from solar farm is still damaging his wife's property

author: @WHSVnews
title: Mount Jackson resident says runoff from solar farm is still damaging his wife's property
text:
Updated: 19 minutes ago
HARRISONBURG, Va. (WHSV) - It’s Agriculture Safety Awareness Week, and the Virginia Farm Bureau is highlighting the AgriSafe Network’s AgriStress Helpline.
Updated: 21 minutes ago
MATHIAS, Wv. (WHSV) - They say life can change in an instant. Whether that “instant” is in a matter of hours or a matter of minutes, life can be altered forever. For Mathias, West Virginia resident Yvonne Davis, her life was forever changed in less than ten minutes.
Updated: 22 minutes ago
FISHERSVILLE, Va. (WHSV) - The Augusta County Library is inviting the community to participate in a week-long Clothing Swap at its Fishersville Main Branch through Mar. 8.
Updated: 3 hours ago
HARRISONBURG, Va. (WHSV) - As the Trump administration continues implementing policy changes, including plans to dismantle the U.S. Department of Education, more than 100 James Madison University students, faculty and local community leaders and advocates gathered to protest Wednesday at JMU’s Memorial Hall.
